input.description: XML document conforming to the Connection Details Concept that contains the information required to execute a command via command line.
Specifies, by logon name, the user whose properties you want to display. If you do not specify a user, the properties of all users are displayed.

Valid values are "permit" and "report". The default value is "report". Specifies whether to show properties for all users or only those whose dial-up permission is set to permit. The permit parameter specifies that properties should be displayed only for users whose dial-up permission is permit. The report parameter specifies that properties should be displayed for all users.

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation Succeed? Valid value: true.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Cisco IOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">show</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">netsh ras show user</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${name}')!=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> name=${name}</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${mode}')!=0"> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="'${mode}'='permit'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> mode=permit</xsl:text> </xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> mode=report</xsl:text> </xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose> </xsl:if> </xsl:if> </command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/bin/echo "Not Supported"</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/usr/bin/echo "Not Supported"</xsl:text> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Displays the properties of a specified remote access user or users.
